etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Mineralogy Magazine. From German Raspit from the name of Charles Rasp, discoverer of the Broken Hill mines, New South Wales, where the first specimen was found + -it

definitions: A tungsten-containing mineral occurring as brownish, yellow, or grey prismatic crystals.

notes.text: Raspite is a lead tungstate, PbWO₄, that is dimorphous with stolzite. Crystal system: monoclinic.
